au.edu.deakin.ice.meltdown

Class GameView

  • java.lang.Object
    • SurfaceView
      • au.edu.deakin.ice.meltdown.GameView
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IceGameView, ScoreView

    public class GameView
extends SurfaceView
    Base class for game states and views. GameView based on the MainPanel from reference: http://www.javacodegeeks.com/2011/07/android-game-development-basic-game_05.html extended with generic drawing functionality

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Queue<DrawData> mDrawQueue
      Queue of bitmaps to draw in display()
      private static String mName
      Class name used for logging
      private Paint mPaint
      Android Paint object needed to draw text objects and clear the screen
      protected Activity mParent
      The parent activity, needed to call the ChangeView and finish() methods
      private boolean mScreenInit
      Is set to true once the screen is ready to use.
      protected Vector2 mScreenSize
      A vector representing the size of the screen, used for calculating motion and object position within the bounds of the screen
      protected SoundManager mSound
      media player object allows the playing of sounds
      private Queue<TextData> mTextQueue
      Queue of Text objects to draw in display()
      private GameThread mThread
      Thread used for calling update and draw at regular intervals

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameView

        public GameView(Context context)
        Constructor. Creates the game thread and links the Game Object and Text Objects static references to the resource cache.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context is needed to access resources within the apk

    • Method Detail

      • kill

        public final void kill()
        Cleans up the GameView and tells its GameThread to wind down

        public final void setParent(Activity mParent)
        Let the GameView know which Activity it reports to.
        Parameters:
        mParent - The Activity that created this gameView

        Ask the View if the screen is ready to use.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating the ready state of the screen

        Draws each object on the renderqueue to the Canvas provided.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas to draw each object to

      • surfaceChanged

        public final void surfaceChanged(SurfaceHolder holder,
                  int format,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Notify GameView that the surface has changed. The view watches this to keep track of the surface size.
        Parameters:
        holder - The parent object that owns the surface
        format - the colour format of the surface
        width - The new width of the surface
        height - The new height of the surface

      • surfaceCreated

        public final void surfaceCreated(SurfaceHolder holder)
        Notify GameView that the surface has been created.
        Parameters:
        holder - The parent object that owns the surface

      • surfaceDestroyed

        public final void surfaceDestroyed(SurfaceHolder holder)
        Notify GameView that the surface has been destroy.
        Parameters:
        holder - The parent object that owns the surface

      • onTouchEvent

        public boolean onTouchEvent(MotionEvent event)
        Called when the screen is interacted with
        Parameters:
        event - Holds the information about the interaction
        Returns:
        True if the GameView would like to continue receiving information about this touch event False if the GameView wants to cancel the event and ignore it in the future

      • ViewInit

        public final void ViewInit()
        Called when the surface has be created. Starts the game threads main loop

      • Init

        public void Init()
        Init exists to allow derived classes to set up their game data.

      • Update

        public void Update()
        Called each game tick to let a derived class update it's game logic.

      • Draw

        public void Draw(Canvas canvas)
        Derived classes use this function to draw all of their graphics.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas to draw to

      • changeView

        public final void changeView(GameView view)
        Change the view being used my MainActivity to the one provided.
        Parameters:
        view - The new view to control the screen
